page.content: HARTLEY ARMS TO LAPLEY WOOD OUR WALK BEGINS AT THE HARTLEY ARMS. BEFORE 1900THE INN WAS CALLED THE CANAL TAVERN,IT WAS RENAMED THE HARTLEY ARMS AFTER SQUIRE HARTLEY OF WHEATON ASTON HALL.THE BOATMEN USED THIS CANALSIDE TAVERN AND DID NOT MIX WITH THE LOCAL PEOPLE.THE INNKEEPER WAS ALSO A FARMER AND THE WHARFINGER.THERE WAS A WEIGH- BRIDGE IN FRONT OF THE INN WHICH WAS NOT ONLY USED FOR GOODS TRAVELLING BY CANAL,BUT ALSO TO WEIGH CARTLOADS OF HAY WHICH USED TO BE TAKEN DAILY FROM THE VILLAGE TO WOLVERHAMTON.IN 1972 THE INN WAS EXTENSIVELY MODERNIZED,NOWADAYS YOU CAN GET SANDWICHES,PLOUGHMANS AND BASKET MEALS AT IT.
